The bubble can be moved around by clicking and holding your cursor and can be closed by clicking the  on the top right.Fig 7. Demo of the lightbulb icon text bubble

On product pages, the information displayed in this bubble corresponds to the information formerly found on Release Guidance tiles.

About this Card

Some resource cards come with additional tips and contextual information.

If you see three dots on the bottom right of a card, you can open a tip with additional information about that particular card. To open the link of that card, you need to close this tip by clicking the three dots button again.

Fig 8. Demo on the About this Card tips

Due to the high demand for dedicated pages for products and services, the number of pages to navigate has grown significantly since launch of the release navigator one year ago and we aim to increase the number of pages even further in future updates. More pages mean more content but also more cards to browse, which can increase the time it takes to find what you’re looking for.

Our goal is for you to find what you need as quickly as possible. That’s why we implemented a new Search Feature, which allows you to search for keywords and find all pages associated with this topic, product or service name. Click on the  Search icon at the shell bar and a pop-up will open. Once you enter key words, you will see which pages are associated to this term and you can jump directly to them. The search feature is optimized for product and service names.

Fig 9. Short demo of the Search function.

We collaborated closely with SAP BTP experts to add a new page for SAP Continuous Integration and Delivery. This page contains links to the release schedule, SAP Roadmap Explorer, What’s New Viewer in the SAP Help Portal and more. Check it out.

Fig 10. The new page for SAP Continuous Integration and Delivery.

Currently, the release navigator for SAP BTP covers content for 27 products and services on dedicated pages. For all products and services not featured with their own page you can find helpful resources on the new General page.

Expect more new pages dedicated to specific products and services in future updates and don't hesitate to let us know via our feedback survey, which products or services you would like to see added next. 

Last update, we announced the new SAP Note Consolidated Release Schedules for SAP BTP and the corresponding initiative of communicating the release schedules of SAP BTP products and services.

We are happy to report that the number of products and services who are communicating their release schedules has further increased to more than 50 now thanks to close collaboration with various SAP BTP teams.

Check the schedules here and from the Release Calendar section of the navigator.

Tip: Did you know you can mark notes as a favorite? If you do so, you will be notified via email whenever the note is being updated. This way you can stay on top of new release schedule communication, like new dates or skipped waves. We recommend you mark all those notes as a favorite that you are interested in receiving updates for.

Fig 11. Where to click to mark a note as a favorite and receive notifications once it gets updated.

Please note: To access SAP Notes you need to log in to SAP for Me using your Universal ID or S-user ID. Read more about the required authorizations here.

Next updates are scheduled on a quarterly basis in alignment with the Harmonized Release Calendar for SAP Cloud Products.*Disclaimer: The schedule is subject to change without prior notice including, when necessary, delays or incorporating changes in subsequent update windows and not a commitment, promise, or legal obligation to deliver any material, code, or functionality.Looking ahead, 2025 updates will mainly focus on quarterly maintenance of release resources and a steady extension of product coverage. Currently, there are no plans for further mayor UI updates in the near future.

The Readiness@Scale team at SAP Enterprise Support is dedicated to ensuring release readiness across the SAP Enterprise Support portfolio. Our mission is to empower SAP customers to be prepared and ready to adopt and utilize innovations.

If you have any feedback or specific requests for content in the release navigator, please don't hesitate to reach out to us.

And don't forget to check out our team's blogs tagged with Readiness@Scale.

Happy navigating!

Readiness@Scale 
SAP Enterprise Support

entry.title: Celebrating a Major Milestone: 5 Million visits of SAP Road Map Explorer
entry.content:
It's with immense gratitude that we announce a significant milestone in our SAP Road Map Explorer journey – reaching 5 million visits! This achievement is more than just a number; it represents the trust, collaboration, and dedication of a remarkable community.

A Heartfelt Thank You to Our Customers

First and foremost, we extend our deepest appreciation to our customers. Your trust in SAP’s road map tool has been the cornerstone of our success. By integrating this tool into your strategic planning, you've not only envisioned but also driven forward the future of your businesses. Your feedback has been invaluable, guiding us in enhancing the tool to meet your evolving needs.

Reflecting on the Journey

When we launched the SAP Road Map Explorer, our goal was to provide a comprehensive tool that simplifies the planning of future technology investments. The journey from inception to reaching 5 million users has been both challenging and rewarding. Each iteration with our customers has been a step towards greater user empowerment, better user experience, and deeper insights.

Looking Ahead

Our journey doesn't stop here. We have exciting updates and new features in the pipeline, all designed to help you stay ahead. Our mission remains to be your trusted partner in navigating the complexities of transformation.

Join Us in the Celebration

We invite you to join us in celebrating this milestone. Share your experiences with the SAP Road Map Explorer, your success stories, and your feedback.

entry.title: Release Navigator for SAP BTP - What' s New in Q4 2024
entry.content:
The Release Navigator for SAP BTP is always evolving to better serve our customers. With the latest update in Q4 2024, in addition to quarterly content maintenance we have added new product pages.

We collaborated closely with SAP BTP experts to add three new product pages that consolidate links to all available release communication channels, like schedules, pre- and post-release communication, blogs, and more.

The new pages are:

  1. SAP BTP, Kyma runtime
  2. SAP Mobile Services
  3. SAP Translation Hub

Read more about the details in this blog post.

This page contains links to release schedule information, SAP Roadmap Explorer, What’s New information in the SAP Help Portal, links to the SAP Community, documentation on releases and available modules, the GitHub Kyma repositories, as well as a helpful learning journey and hands-on tutorials.

Check it out.

Fig 1. The new page for SAP BTP, Kyma runtime.

Check it out.

This page contains links to release schedule information, SAP Roadmap Explorer, What’s New information in the SAP Help Portal, links to the SAP Community, and helpful documentation.

Check it out.

Currently, the release navigator for SAP BTP covers content for 30 products and services on dedicated pages. For all products and services not featured with their own page you can find helpful resources on the new General page.

The Readiness@Scale team at SAP Enterprise Support is dedicated to ensuring release readiness across the SAP Enterprise Support portfolio. Our mission is to empower SAP customers to be prepared and ready to adopt and utilize innovations.

And don't forget to check out our team's blogs tagged with Readiness@Scale.

Happy navigating!

Readiness@Scale

entry.title: Celebrating the Achievements of the SAP Road Map Explorer in 2024
entry.content:
As we end yet another exciting year of transformation, it’s important to reflect on our tool’s achievements. Let’s dive into the highlights that demonstrate how SAP Road Map Explorer has become an indispensable part of our customers’ SAP journey.

Impressive Growth in User Base

This year, the SAP Road Map Explorer hit a significant milestone by surpassing 5 million visits (more here) and almost 30.000 road map items – close to 26.000 delivered and more than 3.000 planned items! The rise in the usage illustrates the trust of our customer base for planning their digital transformations.

Top Business Views: Insights at Your Fingertips

Throughout 2024, certain business views – where we lay the strategic priorities per product - have emerged as favorites:

  1. RISE with SAP
  2. GROW with SAP
  3. Human Capital Management

Worldwide User Locations

Our users span across all continents, from India, to Europe and US and Canada. In Europe, the majority of users are located in Germany, UK, and France.

Most Sought-After Topics

No doubt, SAP S/4HANA, SAP S/4HANA Cloud public edition, followed by SAP Analytics Cloud are the top-3 most searched for products. This year, the top searched included also SAP Signavio, Joule, AI, Datasphere or Ariba.

Happy Holidays & keep in touch!

Be sure to click on thefor a festive surprise!

To stay updated with the latest enhancements and capabilities, join our community page or contact us directly.

 

#SAP #Transformation #Innovation #ERP #Technology #RoadMapExplorer2024

entry.title: SAP Utilities Roadmap 2025 Onwards
entry.content:
The utilities industry will continue to play a key role in SAP's strategy and development topics. It is therefore important to us to provide customers, partners, and the entire SAP Utilities ecosystem with information about the planned innovations.

This year we have once again created a matrix of the respective industry topics and the corresponding innovations. This matrix represents an excerpt of the most important innovations and does not claim to be complete. Over time, further innovations may be added, and delivery periods may also change.

After an overview of the highlights, we will list the details for each topic; behind almost all innovations you will find a link to the SAP Roadmap Explorer with further details.

 

SAP Asset Performance Management

  • AI-powered Joule digital assistant for navigational and transactional use cases Link
  • AI-enabled visual inspection for asset condition monitoring (general availability) Link
  • Advanced asset health monitoring scenarios with embedded IoT Link
  • Custom AI models and algorithms Link

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition

  • Utilizing artificial intelligence to streamline creation and planning of maintenance orders Link
  • Enable external collaboration with subcontractors and service providers Link
  • Enabling integration of service with advanced execution orders (billable maintenance) Link
  • Supporting linear fields in Find Maintenance Order and Operation Link (and many more roadmap items supporting linear assets)
  • Isolation management in a permit to work (lockout tagout) Link

SAP Business Network Asset Collaboration

  • Mass import export APIs for main technical objects Link
  • Digital nameplate Link
  • Enablement of digital twin handover with procurement Link

SAP Field Service Management

  • AI-assisted browsing of knowledge bases Link
  • Multiple technicians in auto-scheduling – crews Link
  • Fully automated planning on the service map Link

SAP Service and Asset Manager

  • Field service crew support Link
  • Management of non-stock items Link
  • OCR for quick data capture Link

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

  • Automatic creation of maintenance notifications for condition-enabled measuring points Link
  • Enable in-house refurbishment Link
  • OCR for quick data capture Link

SAP Maintenance Assistant mobile app

  • AI-enabled maintenance and service execution Link
  • Support for Esri maps integration Link
  • Supporting SAP Dynamic Forms Link

 

Metering

  • Graphical display of utilities interval data Link
  • More flexible status handling for energy data management formulas Link
  • Archiving of technical master data that is specific to the utilities industry Link
  • Enabling custom fields and logic for point-of-delivery and BPEM case data Link

Analytics

  • Extraction of Energy data management related master data Link
  • Using SAP Datasphere in the utilities industry – utilities sales contracts Link
  • Native sales statistics and unbilled revenue reporting in SAP Datasphere and SAP Analytics Cloud Link

Convergent Invoicing

  • End-to-end reconciliation from event to GL in contract accounting and invoicing Link
  • Increase automation of invoicing processes by leveraging machine learning and predictive models Link
  • Reduce time and costs associated with simulation of invoice forecasts for subscription or usage alterations Link

Financials (FI-CA)

  • Display of utilities invoices Link and budget billing plans Link in a business partner financial overview
  • Budget billing plans in the Business Partner Financial Overview app Link
  • Display of utilities invoices in a business partner financial overview Link

 

Customer and Service Management

  • Generative AI–driven digital agent for customer self-service and customer engagement Link
  • Service management for utilities – round-off Link
  • Period control for life cycle events Link
  • Streamlining contract migration and bulk data processing Link
  • Extending pricing capabilities Link
  • Digital payments for service transactions  Link
  • Incorporating the Joule assistant Link

Sales for Commodity & Non-commodity

  • Alignment with the product model of SAP S/4HANA Link
  • Product replication using SAP Master Data Integration Link
  • Intelligent sales execution – target planning Link
  • Intelligent sales execution – product- and volume-based pipeline management Link
  • AI product configuration Link
  • New user interface for the document generation process on the Quote Link
  • Usage-based pricing with integration with SAP Billing and Revenue Innovation Management Link

Commerce Telco & Utilities Accelerator

  • Streamlined material replication for smoother integration Link

Marketing

  • Personalization and segmentation accelerator for utilities Link
  • Advanced personalization and segmentation accelerator for utilities Link

CX AI Toolkit

  • Shopping assistant agent: personalized recommendations Link

 

Distributed Energy Resources (DER)

  • Cancellation of measurement concept instances before device installation Link
  • Analytics for Long-Running Processes Link
  • Enabling validation checks of instances through an API Link
  • Export of a network graph for usage in third-party systems Link
  • Advanced asset health monitoring scenarios with embedded IoT Link
  • AI-powered Joule digital assistant for navigational and transactional use cases Link
  • Integrating AI-based electric vehicle supply equipment (EVSE) asset management Link
  • E-Mobility integration to complementary ecosystem solutions such as energy management Link

Circular Economy

  • Generate a generic waste transportation document to enable shipment of waste Link
  • Integration of waste management and purchasing processes Link
  • Initial Release of SAP Spend Control Tower to provide an enterprise view of total spend Link

Climate Action

  • Carbon emissions allowance management Link
  • Environment management for energy consumption data Link
  • Carbon border adjustment mechanism (CBAM): content with an operator focus Link

Sustainability Accounting

  • Collection and allocation of greenhouse gas emissions in a carbon journal Link
  • Importing emission quantities through file upload Link
  • Accounting for carbon allowances in a carbon journal Link
  • Enabling automatic carbon collections and automated allocations Link
  • Posting and analysis of carbon quantities on external suppliers / affiliated companies Link

E-mobility

  • Charging cost reimbursement for employee charging Link
  • Enabling import and processing of charging sessions from external charge point management systems Link
  • Smart Charging configuration based on user defined parameters Link
  • CO2-based electric vehicle (EV) charging and pricing tariffs handling Link
  • Compatibility with ISO 15118 to support plug-and-charge functionality Link
  • EV Driver authorizations and invoicing in charging groups Link
  • Unidirectional smart charging (V1G) and bi-directional smart charging (V2G) Link

Social Responsibility

  • Electronic submission of recordable injury or illness cases to OSHA as per the legal requirements (cloud) Link
  • Operational risk management: approval of safety instructions for chemicals and equipment (cloud) Link
  • Support for standard, analytical content for workplace safety and social responsibility (cloud) Link
  • Operational risk assessment: visualization of risk history Link

Dangerous Goods Management and Recycling Administration

  • Storing attributes of batteries as basis for the dangerous goods classification Link
  • Additional regulation-specific details for dangerous goods regulations Link
  • Defining customer-specific dangerous goods description templates Link
  • Support for USG-04 in IATA Dangerous Goods Regulations Link

Holistic Steering and Reporting

  • Narrative disclosures, ESG-metric definition, and data collection Link
  • Custom metrics with specific dimension breakdown Link

Please consider that this information and SAP‘s strategy and possible future developments are subject to change and may be changed by SAP at any time for any reason without notice. This document is provided without a warranty of any kind, either express or implied, including but not limited to, the implied warranties of merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose, or non-infringement.

entry.title: #12 - Discover Post-Live Resources
entry.content:
Post-live resources provide ongoing support and help address any issues that arise after the system is live, ensuring a smooth transition to regular operations. 

Picture 1 - Example for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

What’s New  

The What’s New Viewer is an SAP help page for each solution which allows our customers to find the deprecated, changed, and new features between your as-is and to-be SAP Solution release. This is presented in a downloadable list format that can be filtered, it provides a short description to better understand the capabilities delivered and links to technical information of the delivered innovations. 

Release Assessment and Scope Dependency Tool (SAP S/4HANA Cloud public edition, only) 

The release assessment and scope dependency is a simple, self-learning tool for the customers of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. This tool enables the ease of consumption and adoption of impacts, improvements, and innovations which are rolled out with each release and upgrade. 
 
It presents to the customers, a tailor-made list of deleted, deprecated, new and changed objects like apps, APIs  CDS views, Scope Items etc. for each SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition release and continuous delivery. This list is filtered based on the customer’ s used and activated scope which means that the customers only see the changes relevant to them and not the entire list. 

Cloud ALM for operations 

SAP Cloud ALM for Operations empowers customers to understand the health of their SAP business solutions by providing full stack monitoring and alerting covering business processes, integration, users, applications, and health of cloud services and systems. It also allows them to conduct root cause analysis on different levels and act as a collaboration platform between LOB and IT. SAP Cloud ALM enables operations automation by integrating existing automation solutions. It also introduces intelligent event processing to enable event correlation and intelligent alerting to provide transparency regarding availability of business services including event calendar and service level management. 

Continuous Quality Check for Process Adoption (for SAP S/4HANA Cloud, public edition only) 

Continuous Quality Check (CQC) are service reports with an executive summary, findings and a detailed action plan to mitigate risks or improve system usage. As a post live resource there are CQC which according to the solution focus on improving system usage and adopting the latest innovations, business process improvement, optimization of security and performance, monitor and reduce and data volume amongst others. Find more

 Benchmark value assessment (for SAP S/4HANA Cloud, public edition only) 

This is a continuation from the benchmark performed at the discovery phase which output is a personalized scorecard in real-time showcasing a Key Performance Indicator analysis and process maturity gap on best practices in comparison to industry peers for all process areas contained in the solution. Find more here.

Go-Live Solution Adoption & Optimization (for SAP Fieldglass only) 

To get guidance on feature and functionality information, post-release feature adoption guidance, application best practice recommendations and product optimization/adoption, the Product Success Advisory from Fieldglass will offer guidance in a personalized way.  Find more here.

SAP Roadmap Explorer 

SAP Road Map Explorer empowers customers to easily build valuable road maps according to their unique needs update on a regular throughout the year. This is an interactive tool for effective decision making as it informs our customers on existing and upcoming innovations with detailed updates on product innovations allowing for customized filtering per product. Find more here.

Influence Portal 

The SAP Continuous Influence program provides our customers and partners with the opportunity to suggest improvements on SAP products directly to the development teams. This program is specifically aimed towards customers with productive licenses for SAP products and who would like to be able to suggest improvements in a continuously open channel. In addition, our customers can also find initiatives where SAP is looking for early adopters of certain functionalities for testing which grants early access and enhanced support for early testers. 

See more and understand how to influence and get influenced from SAP https://pages.community.sap.com/topics/influence-adopt 

Having questions, comments or feedbacks? Don't hesitate to comment down below or contact 

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Check out other blogs from the series: Customer Onboarding at SAP.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

About the author:

Daniel De Souza is Experience Owner for GROW with SAP at customer onboarding at SAP, bringing a decade of experience in customer management roles in a diverse set of industries and customer sizes. He possesses deep expertise in processes underlying the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition since the start of its commercialization. His strategic approach ensures customers effectively speed up time to value for their GROW with SAP subscriptions.

Having questions, comments or feedbacks? Don't hesitate to comment down below or contact @DanielSouza .

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

entry.title: SAP Solution Roadmap for Oil, Gas, and Energy 2025 Updates
entry.content:
Greetings,

This blog post highlights SAP's Oil, Gas, and Energy solution portfolio roadmap, focusing specifically on innovations and development enabling customers to be their best in the Upstream, Downstream, and Commodity Management space of their business.

SAP's continued collaboration with the industry to build a solution and bring innovations built with the customer and for the customer in the Upstream area of Field Logistics is facilitating the delivery of capabilities and functionality that bring tremendous value to customers managing and executing on the end-to-end process of getting equipment and material to places where work needs to be done and back to where it needs to be once work has been completed.  Through the active engagement of the Field Logistics worskstream, the FPS02 release of Field Logistics is rich and comprehensive in capabilities, functionality, and innovations, making it the minimum release for customers to begin their journey with Field Logistics.  The recent release of FPS03 brings even more capabilities with the addition of use cases related to Goods Receipt, management of Single Plant scenarios, and added features and functions associated with Kitting at remote sites.  Moreover, AI use cases and mobility scenarios are being introduced and released, adding more simplicity and efficiency to the end-to-end process of managing and executing field logistic activities. The following depicts the roadmap for Field Logistics:

Additionally, within the Hydrocarbon Accounting and Management area of Upstream substantial focus has been placed on enabling Clean Core through the release of API's/CDS Views, facilitating accurate and simplified Compliance Reporting, and making automation a more common part of the Production and Revenue accounting monthly and prior-period processing.   A recap of what has been done and preview of what is planned to be done for Upstream Hydrocarbon Accounting and Management exists on the following image:

Within Downstream, several innovations and development items are inflight or planned, as depicted in the diagrams that follow this paragraph.  Most of these are driven by the objective to bridge gaps with other SAP products that are currently available or have been deprecated in the past years. Providing more comprehensive coverage of requirements and enabling an optimized solution landscape is the goal of roadmap activity in the Downstream space.  Presently, Secondary Distribution is most dynamically bringing innovations and building out a comprehensive and capability enriched roadmap.  The following depicts the roadmap for Downstream:

 

Lastly, as it relates to Commodity Management, a board sponsored and budget approved 4-year investment roadmap is being realized, enabling SAP to provide an end-to-end commodity management solution that delivers value-add to our customers and facilitates their move to RISE (incl. AI adoption).  The diagram that follows depicts that roadmap.  Included in that roadmap is an AI use case expected to be released by those of 2025.  AI Assisted Commodity WorkCenter (ACW), which will streamline key front office processes, includes enhanced deal capture capabilities supported by Joule and GenAI.   This roadmap represents significant investment in strong cross industry capabilities, affecting both SAP CM and SAP ACM) which mean increased adoption potential for every $/€ spent, whilst also assisting our customers with their transition to cleaner and more sustainable supply chain portfolios.

A big THANK YOU to Richard Philcox (richard.philcox@sap.com), Jean-Marc DELBOS, (jean-marc.delbos@sap.com), Diana Temirbulatova (diana.temirbulatova@sap.com), and Jythois Sasidhara Varier (Jyothis.sasidhara.varier@sap.com) for their support and input on the Commodity Management, Downstream, and Upstream roadmap content, respectively.

A big THANK YOU to you as well for taking the time to get updated on the roadmap for SAP Oil, Gas, and Energy.

entry.title: SAP Continuous Influence in Finance and Risk
entry.content:
Are you familiar with  SAP Continuous Influence? Do you know which sessions are available for solutions in Finance and Risk? Learn more about how you can influence the product roadmap and collaborate with our SAP Product Management teams.

Here is a summary of the sessions that may be of interest to you, our SAP customers and partners, in the area of Finance and Risk:

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, Finance
https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/campaign/1169

Access this session to view and submit influence requests on:

CategoryDescription
Accounting and Financial Close

General Ledger Accounting, Asset Accounting, Entity Close, Accruals/Deferrals, Intercompany Reconciliation, Tax

Advanced Financial CloseClosing Task Management on BTP:
Manage Closing Task Lists, Process and Approve Closing Tasks, Reporting, Configuration and Administration of AFC
Financial Planning and AnalysisOverhead Accounting, Inventory Accounting, Production Accounting, Sales Accounting, Predictive Accounting, Financial Planning, Profit Center Accounting, Universal Allocation, Margin Analysis, Revenue Recognition
Financial Operations

Accounts Receivable, Accounts Payable, Receivables Management, Credit Management, Collections and Dispute Management, Dunning, Digital Payment Processing, Invoice Management

Treasury ManagementTreasury Workstation, Cash and Liquidity Management, Debt and Investment Management, Treasury and Risk Management, Lockbox, Payments and Bank Communications, Working Capital Management
Advanced Payment ManagementPayment Processing, Account Management, In-House Banking, Multi-Bank Connectivity
Contract and Lease ManagementRental Objects, Contact Management, Invoices for Rent
Enterprise Risk and ComplianceInternational Trade Management, Governance, Risk and Compliance

Session voting threshold: 12 company votes

 

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and Private Edition, Group Reporting
https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/campaign/2283

This session follows a public cloud first approach while typically providing the requested functionality in the upcoming releases for SAP S/4HANA (on-premise) and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition.

You are invited to submit and vote on improvement requests related to:

DescriptionCategory
Core data collection functionsIdeas on data release task, flexible file import data writing APIs, data copy, manual journal entries, mass-reversal.​
Core consolidation functionsIdeas on further increasing the efficiency / level of automation in core automatic posting tasks such as annual net income calculation, currency translation, reclassification, posting rules, equity pick-up, restatement, profit elimination in inventory, consolidation of investments.
Master dataIdeas on master data improvements such as, global hierarchies, financial statement items, consolidation units, consolidation group, consolidation group structure, addition consolidation field master data, customer extended field master data, master data APIs.
AnalyticsIdeas on group reporting specific analytics exposed into generic analytics tools such as design studio client, web dynpro grid client, SAP Analytics Cloud and Analysis for Microsoft Office. Ideas on tool improvements not specific to group reporting should be posted to other areas. Ideas on group reporting specific analytics enhancements should be posted here
PlanningIdeas on group level planning such the integration of Group Reporting based consolidation and analytics with SAP Analytics Cloud based plan data. Plan scenario specific requirements such as multi-period processing, version management
Manual data collection (GRDC)Ideas on manual data collection in Group Reporting Data Collection, e.g. on scenarios to manually collect additional finance data and non-finance data, and texts beyond the integration of trial balances.​
Data Mapping (GRDC)Ideas on data mapping in Group Reporting Data Collection which allows to import external data, convert the data and store it to Group Reporting core repository for scenarios such as file import, pull data from remote, push data to a GRDC mapping API.
Process control (monitors, AFC, task logs)Ideas on process control, such as adoption of Advanced Finance Close (AFC) in Group Reporting, workflow, release, sign-off tasks, task logs etc. 
Pre-delivered content Ideas on improving the pre-delivered content configuration to allow the initial adoption of the solution even faster or where additional content shipped in an upgrade would be beneficial. Examples: additional scenarios that can be built by pure configuration based on existing functionality or where existing configuration could be improved, e.g. to achieve higher level of automation in reclassification rules.​
Data quality and validationIdeas on the totals validation and line-item validation and substitution such as additional features in defining validation rules.​
Inter Company Matching and Reconciliation​Ideas on Inter-Company matching and reconciliation including ICMR driven adjustment and elimination postings, and process integration of ICMR.

Session voting threshold: 9 company votes

New Session (May 2025): SAP Risk and Assurance Management
https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/campaign/3917

Access the session and submit requests on:

Issue Management and Remediation

Business Content Hub, E2E, and Integration

Automated Procedures

Data Consolidation and Task Service

Controls and Work Packages

Manual Procedures

Risks and Master Data

Session voting threshold: 10 company votes

Learn more about the new SAP Risk and Assurance Management Continuous Influence Session here.

 How the sessions work

Vote for Improvement Requests

Search for your topic of interest and vote for Improvement Request(s) you wish to support and plan to take advantage of in your organization.

--- or ---

Submit Improvement Request

If you cannot find an Improvement Request that matches your need, use the “Submit Improvement” button to create a new Improvement Request.

Wait for Review

Once your Improvement Request has been submitted, other companies can see and vote for it.

Improvement requests that reach the voting threshold are guaranteed to be reviewed during the next review cycle.

The frequency of review cycles is mentioned on the session's homepage.

Review Cycle Communication

After the review cycle has ended, a blog is posted to the session’s homepage with information on the accepted and delivered improvement requests.

If the coach was not able to make a final decision on the Improvement Request during the review cycle, the Improvement Request will be included in the next review cycle.

Would you like to submit a request for API development? If so, you can submit them in the dedicated sessions for SAP S/4HANA Cloud and SAP S/4HANA for Integration and the SAP S/4HANA Cloud and SAP S/4HANA for Key User and Developer Extensibility  When submitting the request, ensure to complete the questions in the template and provide us with the business requirement and usage scenario that the API addresses.

In the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, Finance session we only consider requests for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, Finance. Please see the following Blog to learn about how you can influence the SAP S/4HANA On Premise Roadmap. A direct link to the new SAP S/4HANA, private edition session can be found here.

SAP also has a dedicated session for localization topics. Learn more about Customer Influence and Globalization Services here. 

Check out the SAP Roadmap Explorer to learn more about what is planned throughout 2025 and our product vision for 2026. 

 

Additional Information

Would you like to learn more about Customer Influence and Adoption? Read the following Blog.

Get Started and Navigate the Customer Influence Site NOW!

We look forward to receiving your influence requests and collaborating with you!
